ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the country of Ceti on his way to Bhaddavatikā.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.2_0: A number of cow-herds, shepherds, farmers, and travelers saw the Buddha coming.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.3_0: And they said to him, “Venerable Sir, don’t go to Ambatittha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.4_0: This Ambaṭṭha was residing in Uruvelā’s psychic power.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.5_0: Don’t let it harm the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.6_0: When this was said, the Fortunate One remained silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.10_0: This Ambaṭṭha was residing in Uruvelā’s psychic power.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.11_0: Don’t let it harm the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.12_0: but the Buddha still remained silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.13_0: The Buddha eventually arrived at Bhaddavatikā.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.14_0: Then Sāgata went to the hermitage of that dreadlocked ascetic.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.14_1: and after approaching, he sat down cross-legged, with his body straight, and establishes mindfulness right there.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.15_0: Seeing that Sāgata had entered the fire hut, the dragon was upset and emitted smoke.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.17_0: The dragon was not able to contain his rage and emitted flames.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.18_0: Sāgata entered the fire element and he, too, emitted flames.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.19_0: Then, after conquering fire with fire, Sāgata went to Bhaddavatikā. Soon afterwards the lay followers at Kosambī heard that Sāgata had fought the Ambatittha dragon.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.20_0: After staying at Bhaddavatikā for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kosambī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.21_0: The lay followers heard that they had gone to Kosambī with him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.22_0: When he eventually arrived at Kosambī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.22_1: Then the lay follower Kosambī went to meet him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.23_0: After receiving the Buddha, the lay followers went to see Sāgata.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.23_1: They bowed, stood to one side, and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.24_0: “Venerable, what may we prepare for you that’s hard to obtain yet pleasant?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.25_0: The monks from the group of six said to those lay followers, “Did you get some soup?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.26_0: And the lay followers prepared Kāpotikā liquor in house after house. Then, when they saw that Sāgata had entered the town for alms, they said to him, “Drink, Venerable, drink the Kāpotikā liquor.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.27_0: Sāgata drank that liquor in house after house, and as he was leaving town, he collapsed at the town gate.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.28_0: Just then the Buddha, together with a number of monks, was also leaving town, and he saw Sāgata collapsed at the town gate.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.30_0: Saying, “Yes, Sir,” they led him to the monastery, where they put him down with his head toward the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.31_0: But Sāgata turned around, pointing his feet toward the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.32_0: The Buddha said, “Previously, monks, wasn’t Sāgata respectful and deferential toward me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.34_0: “But is he now respectful and deferential toward me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.36_0: “Just recently, didn’t Sāgata fight with the Ambatittha dragon?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.38_0: “Would he now be able to fight with a dragon?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.40_0: “So, monks, should one drink that which makes one senseless?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.42_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for Sāgata, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.43_0: How could Sāgata drink alcoholic drinks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.44_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.45_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.46.1_0: “An offense entailing confession for drinking alcohol.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.2_0: alcoholic drinks made from flour, alcoholic drinks made from pastries, alcoholics drink made from rice, those with yeast added, those made from a combination of ingredients.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.4_0: the tree with trunks of trees, cramped and quartzed, swallowed, and quart.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.6_0: even if she drinks the tip of a blade of grass, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.1_0: If it is an alcoholic drink, and he perceives it as such, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.2_0: If it is an alcoholic drink, but he is unsure of it, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.3_0: If it is an alcoholic drink, but he perceives it as non-alcoholic, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.4_0: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, but he perceives it as alcoholic, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.5_0: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.6_0: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, and he perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.2_0: if he drinks a non-alcoholic drink that has the color of an alcoholic drink, the smell of an alcoholic drink, or the taste of an alcoholic drink;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.3_0: if it is cooked in a bean curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.4_0: if it is cooked with meat;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.5_0: if it is cooked with oil;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.7_0: if he drinks a drink that is normally alcoholic, but which is actually without alcohol;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.9_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.10_0: The first rule, the training rule on drinking alcoholic drinks, is finished.
